data.meta_site_name: McCammon Ammons Click Funeral Home, INC.
data.text: Lloyd Kenneth Baldwin, age 86 of Knoxville, TN, passed away Monday, March 23, 2015. Lloyd was a veteran of the United States Army. He was retired from Reynolds Metals Company in McCook, Illinois, and was a member of Marble City Baptist Church. His passion was playing music on guitar, pursuing knowledge, and loving his family. Preceded in death by daughter-in-law, Tracy Baldwin; brothers, T. S. "Buddy" Baldwin, Lester Baldwin, Clarence Henry Baldwin, Sr.; and sisters, Mary Alice Simerly and Gladys Linginfelter. Survivors include his wife, Betty Baldwin; daughter, Deb Holly and husband Rich; son, Rex Baldwin and wife Theresa; son, David; grandchildren, Ashley Scholten and husband Jason, Kristen Holly, Katelyn Holly; great-grandchildren, Ruby Scholten, Rex Scholten; sister-in-law, Maxine Stonecipher and husband Mark; several nieces and nephews. The family will receive friends from 5:30-7:00 p.m. Wednesday at McCammon-Ammons-Click Funeral Home, followed by funeral services at 7:00 p.m. with Rev. Dennis (Pastor D) Blazier, and W. C. Thornton officiating. Family and friends will meet at 10:00 a.m. Thursday at Union Grove Cemetery for the interment service.
